engine
Class Application

java.lang.Object

public class Application
extends SwingFrontEnd

High level class to control game engine flow and usage

dgattey

onTick

protected void onTick(long nanosSincePreviousTick)
The three main methods to control the game, onDraw, onTick, and onResize pass through their calls to the current screen for it to respond appropriately, though onResize also saves the new size and calls onResize for all screens in the stack

Specified by:
onTick in class CS195NFrontEnd
Parameters:
nanosSincePreviousTick - approximate number of nanoseconds since the previous call to onTick

onDraw

protected void onDraw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Description copied from class: CS195NFrontEnd
Called when the screen needs to be redrawn. This is at least once per tick, but possibly more frequently (for example, when the window is resizing).

Note that the entire drawing area is cleared before each call to this method. Furthermore, CS195NFrontEnd.onResize(cs195n.Vec2i) is guaranteed to be called before the first invocation of onDraw.

Specified by:
onDraw in class CS195NFrontEnd
Parameters:
g - a Graphics2D object used for drawing.

onResize

protected void onResize(Vec2i newSize)
Description copied from class: CS195NFrontEnd
Called when the size of the drawing area changes. Any subsequent calls to onDraw should note the new size and be sure to fill the entire area appropriately. Guaranteed to be called before the first call to onDraw.

Specified by:
onResize in class CS195NFrontEnd
Parameters:
newSize - the new size of the drawing area.
